attributes.action: Calling on the Government not to make any exceptions to tax rules at local level
attributes.additional_details:
We are in a cost of living crisis and this is an unfair 15% council tax raise being put through in Croydon that has been allowed to happen by government without a consultation and referendum being put to the residents.

Government should not get involved in local level matters and set presidents that will allow a loop holes for other local authorities to request similar interference. The rule regarding a referendum is there for a purpose and should be respected.
attributes.background: Petition calling on the Government not to make any exceptions to requirements for local authorities to hold referendums on council tax increases of more than 5%

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/632944
